title: Chelsea transfer news: Asmir Begovic, Michy Batshuayi, Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Charly Musonda set to leave
text:
Feeling Blue Chelsea transfer news: Asmir Begovic, Michy Batshuayi, Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Charly Musonda set to leave 
Antonio Conte has stayed true to same group of players this season and outcasts could depart in search of first-team action Gossip Comments CHELSEA could allow up to FOUR players to leave Stamford Bridge this month. 
Antonio Conte’s men are flying high at the top of the table largely down to his new system and rigid team selection. Reuters 5 Antonio Conte could be set to allow FOUR Chelsea players to leave this month 
A number of big names are no longer getting a look in at Chelsea due to the lack of European competition. Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
And now a sizeable group could be heading to new clubs in search of regular action. 
The Telegraph claims Asmir Begovic , Michy Batshuayi , Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Charly Musonda are all hopeful of moves away from west London. Getty Images Asmir Begovic is wanted by Bournemouth in a permanent deal Michael Owen says Liverpool can halt Chelsea's title charge at Anfield Getty Images Michy Batshuayi is yet to start a league game due to Diego Costa's form 
Changes to the team are expected when Chelsea take on Brentford in the FA Cup this weekend. 
But the quartet could be left out to entice clubs into making bids. 
Goalkeeper Begovic is a target for Bournemouth , although Antonio Conte will not sanction his exit unless a suitable replacement is found. Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport's daily LIVE blog Related Stories All the latest breaking news and gossip from the January transfer window BLUE MOVE Chelsea ace Branislav Ivanovic ready to snub Everton, Leicester and West Ham for big-money move to Zenit BEE IN BONNET Former Chelsea starlet Josh McEachran was chased by Madrid at 16 - but now he faces Blues with Brentford on my ped, son Chelsea 'make offer that can't be refused' for Brazilian wonderkid Pedrinho PA:Press Association Ruben Loftus-Cheek has barely featured despite being a regular in the pre-season Getty Images 5 Charly Musonda is unlikely to be handed many chances for the remainder of the campaign 
Batshuayi, Loftus-Cheek and Musonda remain big prospects for the future and therefore will only be allowed to leave on loan. 
However, Chelsea fans shouldn’t expect to see any new arrivals at the Bridge despite being linked with a host of players. 
Fernando Llorente’s anticipated move from Swansea looks to be over after Diego Costa’s short-term future was sorted, while the return of Kurt Zouma from injury means there’s no rush to find another centre-back.
